summary: Full-text query across indexed sources with BM25 scoring. Use this to decide which spans to fetch via `blz get`.

primary_usage.description: Default mode. JSON hits expose alias, headingPath, lines, snippet, checksum, and score.
Scope to a single alias and paginate deterministically.
Shortcut—no subcommand still performs a search; force JSON via the env var.

query_language: Terms separated by spaces are OR'd (match any term by default).
Exact phrase: wrap in double quotes, escape with single quotes: `blz '"background fetch"'`.
Require terms: prefix with `+` for AND logic: `blz '+api +key rotation'` (requires 'api' AND 'key', 'rotation' optional).
Scores are BM25—higher scores indicate stronger matches.
workflow_for_agents: One-shot retrieval (recommended): Use `blz search "<query>" --context all --format json` to get full sections immediately.
Two-step approach (precise control): Select the top hit's alias and lines string (example: `react:220-228`), then fetch with `blz get react:220-228 --context 3 --format text`.
When multiple ranges from the same alias are needed, use one call: `blz get react --lines "220-228,260-264" --context 2 --format json`.
Record the checksum to guarantee later steps detect stale spans.

helpful_flags.impact: Traverse pagination without manually tracking page numbers.
Keep only top percentile of hits (post-pagination) to reduce noise.
Augment text output (when not using JSON) with rank/url/anchor metadata.
Control snippet length in total characters (default: 200, range: 50-1000). Higher values provide more context for relevance assessment without fetching full content.
Returns full sections around each hit for one-shot retrieval. Use --max-lines to cap output size.
Adds ±N lines of context around each hit for lighter-weight expansion.

post_processing_examples: Filter by minimum score: `blz search "sdk" --format json | jq '[.[] | select(.score > 60)]'`.
Group by alias: `blz search "migration" --format json | jq 'group_by(.alias) | map({alias: .[0].alias, hits: length})'`.
Pipe to multiget: `blz search "hooks" --format json | jq -r '.[0] | (.alias + " --lines " + .lines)' | xargs -I{} blz get {} --context 2 --format json`.
